data.title: Mechanic , Thief , Engineer
data.body:
For Allies : 
- [x] Mechanic instant capturing husks and get a vehicle with low hp (still costs 500) 
  he will dissapear after capturing 

For Soviet : 
- [x] Thief instant capturing any Vehicle , and the Vehicle changes his Owner (should cost more then 500) he will dissapear after capturing , and is "not" cloaked

data.title: Engineers in Red Alert should have player colors like in Tiberian Dawn
data.body:
In Red Alert mod, engineers don't have player colors, so it's not possible to tell which team they belong to by just looking at them. They should have color indicators like in Tiberian Dawn mod.

Here is a comparison:
Red Alert engineer (red):
![ra_eng](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6599106/2428419/20ad9230-ac47-11e3-9678-e7e6730bd146.png)

Tiberian Dawn engineer (red):
![td_eng1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6599106/2428420/27fba5e0-ac47-11e3-8602-e8c6d9ef2942.png)

Tiberian Dawn engineer (blue):
![td_eng2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6599106/2428421/2c6f8164-ac47-11e3-8969-0ead4b562ad3.png)

This also shows the size difference between ra and td mods. These screenshots were taken with the same screen resolution and with pixel doubling turned on.

data.title: Multiple engineers should capture buildings faster
data.body:
Right now only one engineer can capture a certain building at the same time. It should be possible to use multiple engineers to speed up the capturing process.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1439906-multiple-engineers-should-capture-buildings-faster?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Implement a restart mission button
data.body: This would be useful for single player but also for multi player game. It would restart the game with the same settings. In multiplayer, there could be a logic similar to the ready tick box in game lobby. If every player agrees, the game restarts.

data.title: Make approach direction of paratrooper plane controllable
data.body: There is no way (or no easy way) of telling from which direction the paratroopers will arrive. Often times the plane flies right towards anti-air defenses and gets shot down. There should be a way to at least determine from which direction the plane approaches the drop site in order to avoid AA and make paratroopers more useful. This could be done by drawing a vector for example.

data.title: Mapped password field Enter/ESC to buttons
data.body: as wished in #4869.

data.title: Add a production tab for fake/decoy buildings
data.body:
It is possible to build fake buildings using the debug menu. This should also be possible in normal game. It would make for interesting game play strategies. Also allied players should be able to see which buildings are real and which are fake. There could be an indication on fake ones.

<bountysource-plugin>

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Engineers should repair buildings the same way mechanics repair vehicles
data.body:
Right now engineers can repair buildings in an instant and they disappear with this action. It would be better if they repaired buildings from the outside incrementally. They should not disappear after the repair and the repair should be cost-free like that of the mechanic. And multiple engineers should repair faster.

data.title: Feature Request * Enter key "retry"
data.body:
when trying to join a server using a password, a player has to click Retry.
Please make pressing the enter key whilst in the password box, automatically "retry"

data.title: Ideas about husks
data.body: Husks should not disappear after a certain amount of time. They should stay on the field indefinitely but the flame effect should stop after a time. It's great that they are capturable now but they should also be destructable like walls or bridges. They shouldn't have health bars, only visual cues to show how close to destruction they are.

data.title: Made husks crushable
data.body:
Reasoning
- cool effect, feels right (idea stolen from Tiberium Wars)
- clean up the battlefield for better overview together with https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4673
- can be used to deny captures: balance https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4517
- fixes an exploit where people rush with 1tnk to block refinery or factory using it's husk http://youtu.be/ZzHp4sK0ryU?t=3m3s

data.title: Replay playback no longer works
data.body:
It will just sit there and the game won't tick or anything
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/8707714/OpenRA-2014-03-15T063038Z.rep triggers it for Ripley` & I

data.title: Extend chronosphere ability to infantry
data.body:
Chronosphere can only be used on vehicles. The logic behind that is that infantry can not be teleported and those that are inside an APC die if that APC is teleported using chrono. But this logic is not consistent. All vehicles are operated by infantry. For example, sometimes after a tank is destroyed, the infantry inside survives and gets out. So when a tank is teleported, the infantry inside is also teleported without an issue. To make this consistent and also to enrich game tactics, chronosphere should have the ability to teleport infantry. 

But this could make chronosphere a too powerful weapon because each square can hold five infantry and chronosphere teleports five squares which equals a maximum of 25 infantry. 25 Flamethrowers for example could be too overpowered and destroy significant amount of buildings. Actually even this could be an acceptable strategy since it is possible to prevent this by placing scattered artillery or V2 throughout the base. But if chronosphere would be deemed overpowered with this change, then its ability could be limited to five units instead of five squares. A different unit selection method would be required for this. And an APC with four infantry inside would count as five units. Or it could be extended to six units and a full APC could then be teleported.

data.title: Fixed husk flames
data.body: for realsies now.

data.title: RA SAM Sites have only a small area for player color remap
data.body: ~~The only way to check SAM ownership in RA is to hover over for the tooltip, so the player color should be shown on the building.~~ Currently the remappable section of an RA SAM Site is pretty small and not very obvious. I have no concept in mind for how it could be improved.

data.title: Radar dome's should have faction specific motion sensors
data.body:
The Allies would have a motion sensor for submarines and infantry while the soviets would have a motion sensor for vehicle's and plane's or something along that line.

That would also make radar scramblers,gap/mobile generators actualy worth a damn.

data.title: Fixed husk flames (modified)
data.body: Modifies #4833 by fixing the issue in BelowUnits instead of removing it.  This should fix #4762 without breaking anything that relies on BelowUnits. :+1: from me for the two patches by @Mailaender.

data.title: Edit and organize replay files from within OpenRA
data.body: This would be a great convenience, especially when dealing with hundreds of games in the replay folder. The initial replay filenames aren't exactly descriptive and it can be time-consuming when you e.g. want to go back and compile certain replays from another time period.

data.title: Spy class refactoring
data.body:
This PR:
- Adds the `IEffectiveOwner` interface which is used by `AppearsFriendlyTo/AppearsHostileTo` extensions, and enables us to fix a bug with spies & team health colors (fixed in a later PR).
- Renamed Spy to Disguise - classes mentioning "Spy" were renamed with "Disguise" to feel more generic, since this naming is more appropriate for other units that may disguise (RA2 Mirage tank for example). Disguise also implements `IEffectiveOwner`.

Another followup PR will be to clean up IToolTip's "properties"

data.title: Add changelog entry for Radar Dome cost tweak.
Tabs in yaml files break 3rd party parsers
data.body:
It looks like most of the yaml files used by OpenRA are using tabs for indentation. I was trying to parse one of them with a library and got a bunch of errors as a result. It looks like tabs for indentation are [not allowed](http://www.yaml.org/faq.html) by the yaml spec ([see section6.1](http://yaml.org/spec/1.2/spec.html)). Of course OpenRA doesn't have to completely follow the spec (and you can replace tabs with spaces before parsing), but it would be nice if it did for tool compatibility.

From what I can tell, OpenRA uses [its own yaml parser class](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/master/OpenRA.FileFormats/MiniYaml.cs) so maybe that implementation only supports tabs or something.

Apologies if this is a duplicate, I couldn't find an existing discussion on this by searching the repo.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1439218-tabs-in-yaml-files-break-3rd-party-parsers?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Improve cloaking logic and add phase transport
data.body: Also paves the way for an easy sonar pulse implementation, which I can PR soon after.

data.title: More Lua updates
data.body:
The important bit here is the Team.CreateFromTemplate function. This makes working with factories much easier.

The Actor.RepairBuilding function is also a nice addition, makes the AI feel more alive.

data.title: Airstrike improvements
data.body:
This adjusts the way in which flares, cameras, and beacons work:
- Flares spawn when the attack is ordered, and removed 1 second (configurable) after the attack completes.
- Cameras spawn when the attack begins, and removed 1 second (configurable) after it completes.
- Beacons spawn when the attack is ordered, and removed when the attack begins.

It also fixes bombs being rendered through the fog, and fixes flares and cameras being treated as aircraft.

data.title: Overhaul ingame timer displays.
data.body:
Removes the hard-coded timer widget, fixes the timer ticking when the game is paused (#3062), and adds playback speed labels for #4233.

![timers](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/2392340/5425b9d6-a976-11e3-9861-e9d2d40aaec8.png)

data.title: There should be a link to map editor in Main Menu
data.body:
Adding a button to start the (optional) map editor seems fine, since the Mac OS X version of OpenRA doesn't contain a map editor and an app bundle can only contain a main executable so it seems to be one of the only ways to let players run that map editor with ease.
Well, using a choice panel like Libreoffice does also seems okay. However it makes starting the game a bit slower and seems stupid.

as they can block starting the game for everyone wether intended or not. Timeout after X minutes of no new orders sent might help combat trolls / careless players.

data.title: "Autodirector" for spectator mode
data.body:
A couple weeks ago I started a branch in order to code a spectatormode in which you can let the computer decide what's hot and what's not in an observed game.

Newer games like League of Legends, CS: Go, Dota2 and even older games of which I didn't know, have an automatically directed camera view for the viewer to use.

This isn't really something a caster would use, but there could be still moments where you would like the camera not to be on something meaningless while you need to do something else.

Or maybe you want to casually sit back, relax and watch a replay without having to do anything.

Aside from potentially crazy software patents that may or may not be valid in your country http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/1x3v1u/riot_games_granted_us_patent_on_spectator_mode/ - I still wanted to give it a go and code it.

So I have a basic version I haven't touched for a week or so, and I would like to get some wild criticism or suggestions on this.

Code:

https://github.com/partouf/OpenRA/compare/bleed...autodirector

This is an old video, because for some reason the one I recorded just now hasn't been saved: http://www.twitch.tv/partouf/b/506940934

Edit: oh it did save after all: http://www.twitch.tv/partouf/b/509993907

(visual difference from current version and that one recorded is that there's now a checkbox (or key F5) to enable the autodirector (default off), and most decisionmaking is less buggy)

There still plenty of bugs to fix, like
- some wrong decisions when armies are close enough to pan the camera, but still jumps
- some moments where the camera gets stuck, probably because of units that still have IsAttacking on eventhough they're not doing anything
- attacking helicopters or planes sometimes aren't really registering

Stuff I still want to implement myself, like watch dropping nukes and similar airweapons for example.

And I still need to test and see if it works just as well with regular people playing the game.

But as I said, I would like to know what other people think of it and what ideas you might have.
